data.title: Console should display what was deleted when deleting a project global property
data.body: When deleting a global property in project settings, it would be nice if the console would output what was deleted and what value it had. I've deleted properties on accident before and this would make it a lot simpler to correct that, as otherwise I don't even know what was deleted.

data.title: is_nan does not work as intended
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, 2.1.4-beta

**Issue description:**
I had a bug in my script where a value sometimes got NaN.
But checking this with `is_nan()` doesn't work because it always returns false.

But I'm sure that the number had a NaN value because `print(str(is_nan(target_pos.x)) + " " + str(target_pos.x))` prints `False nan` and `False -nan`

**Steps to reproduce:**
Produce a NaN value and pass it to `is_nan`

data.title: Fixed set_global_scale in Node2D.
data.body: Changed set_global_scale based on observations I made [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/9355#issuecomment-312693399).

data.title: Fixed ResourceSaver::save not working with GDScript EditorPlugin
data.body:
Since this is my first contribution in a public repository, please note that I don't completely understand how git works, so expect mistakes in that area. With that out of the way:

**Initial behavior:** Calls to `ResourceSaver::save(path, resource)` with an edited object from a GDScript editor plugin resulted in the resource being null when it arrived at the C++ function from GDScript.

**Issue:** The edited object was passed to editor plugins through the edit() function as a Variant, which was constructed by the Variant::Variant(Object*) constructor. However the constructor did not handle the case of the passed Object being a Reference, meaning that the variant was not considered to hold a Reference at that point (Nor a Resource, in the case of `ResourceSaver::save`) so I added a special case for that.

Also, I removed the (already commented out), `operator RefPtr()` in reference.h, which seems to have now been replaced by the more direct `operator Variant()`

**Fixes Issue:**#6603

data.title: Bad Polygon error when editing a color in Gradient
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Antergos x86_64 |  e63c64e256bc77618e4ea5ab13ecba6306ced0e6

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
This error occurs when trying to change a color stop in Gradient.
```
ERROR: canvas_item_add_polygon: Bad Polygon!
   At: servers/visual/visual_server_canvas.cpp:652.
```
The engine won't exit normally after. (Project Manager won't be launched when quit to Project List)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create new Gradient in the Inspector
2. Click on a color stop
3. Click on the color preview to popup ColorPicker

data.title: It should be impossible to delete predefined global properties in project settings
data.body: It would be nice to have a have pop-up warning to confirm before you delete a global property. I have deleted global properties on accident several times by mis-clicking and hitting the 'Del' button when going to exit out of the Project Settings window. As it is right now, they are instantly deleted with no warning, and nothing in the console telling you what happened or what was deleted.

data.title: collada importer should replace . or / with another for node name
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Blender often uses `.` character for a name.
But Godot does not allow `.` or `/` for node name.
~~~So better collada should replace it with something another.~~~
collada importer should replace . or / with another for node name

this might be related to #5808.

data.title: Implemented borderless fullscreen code on OSX.
data.body:
With this PR it's possible to implement a "borderless fullscreen window" mode on OSX.

The following GDscript code would trigger this:
`OS.set_borderless_window(true)`
`OS.set_window_size(OS.get_screen_size())`
`OS.set_window_position(Vector2(0, 0))`

This mode can then be easily switched off with:
`OS.set_borderless_window(false)`

data.title: Grandchild of Armature unresponsive to animation (Ignore, stupid mistake)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The project is based around sub-nodes of the character serving as equip-slots that follow the 3D object's animation. They're empty objects, having location, but no surface data.
In Blender they follow the animation perfectly, but in Godot they remain stationary.
Additionally, for some very odd reason, the importing process moves the empty objects to seemingly random areas around the character.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Use the Godot exporter for blender to export a rigged and animated character with multiple objects.
If something is a child of an object that is a child of the armature, it will behave properly in Blender, but not in Godot.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Light data appears to be inaccessible in shaders
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, godot 3.0 bb9daaccfff193b9b20ff0679baef716fc6ee892

**Issue description:**
I would like to access light data (specifically light positions) in my shaders, but it does not appear to be exposed.  

First I tried accessing "omni_lights" and "omni_light_indices" (declared + used in scene.glsl) in my fragment() and light() shader functions.  They were inaccessible.

Then I tried adding the following lines to shader_compiler_gles3.cpp:
```cpp
	actions[VS::SHADER_SPATIAL].renames["OMNI_LIGHTS"] = "omni_lights";
	actions[VS::SHADER_SPATIAL].renames["OMNI_LIGHT_INDICES"] = "omni_light_indices";
	actions[VS::SHADER_SPATIAL].renames["OMNI_LIGHT_COUNT"] = "omni_light_count";
	actions[VS::SHADER_SPATIAL].usage_defines["OMNI_LIGHTS"] = "#define USE_FORWARD_LIGHTING\n";
```
But the new names (ex: "OMNI_LIGHTS") were also inaccessible.  I'm guessing their types also need to be registered in shader_types.cpp, but it looks like theres no way to register struct or array types.  Which is a problem because omni_lights is an array of LightData.

Unless I hear otherwise, I won't continue working on this as I'm guessing @reduz probably knows how this should be done.

Or maybe this functionality already exists and I'm totally wrong 😄

data.title: Added annotations to GDScript
On OSX export to DMG and optionally code sign the app bundle
data.body:
This is still somewhat experimental but I think its nearly complete.

When exporting your game for Mac OS X from anything but Mac OS X the logic works as with earlier versions of Godot. The app bundle is produced as a zip file. The problem with this is that this app bundle isn't code signed and when unzipping the application is marked as quarantined and won't run. Also the file permissions don't seem to be correct so you'll always end up making at least some changes.

When exporting your game for Mac OS X on a Mac the logic has now changed. The application bundle is optionally signed and then packed up in a DMG. The creation of the DMG is pretty straight forward and could use a few improvements such as adding a background image and adding a link to Applications so you can drag/drop your game. 

Code signing is the experimental bit because Apple is deliberately very unclear on manually code signing applications and what their exact requirements are.
https://developer.apple.com/library/content/documentation/Security/Conceptual/CodeSigningGuide/Procedures/Procedures.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40005929-CH4-SW2
They expect you to use XCode. I'll have to start work on some documentation because manually creating the certificates you need through developer.apple.com and knowing what to download can be tricky.
Also I have no exposure deploying on the App Store, what I've done should however works for providing applications outside of the App Store and may work if you want to deploy to App Store.

In the export window there are now two new fields under a section called CodeSign
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1945449/27769492-fe27d454-5f6d-11e7-9594-3e297c173e72.png)
Identity should be set to the name of the certificate entry of your signing certificate as its stored in keychain. I'm using my 'Mac Developer' certificate in this screenshot which is fine for testing but you're supposed to use different ones for deploying.

The entitlements setting probably isn't implemented fully yet, this allows you to point to an entitlements.plist file that is used along with the signing process but what I do not know is if this entitlements file should also be bundled into your application bundle. The entitlements file lets OSX know what it can expect your application uses, does it open network connections, does it use the camera, etc, and sandbox the application. This is optional if you control the deployment of your app but mandatory if you deploy through the App Store if I understand correctly.

data.title: Script editor search: F3 hotkey for "next" conflicts with 3D viewport
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux x64, Godot *master*

**Issue description:**
When doing a text search in the script editor, F3 (supposed to highlight the next match) goes to the 3D viewport. The script editor shortcut should take precedence over the editor node one.

In 2.1 it used to work by chance as F3 was the shortcut for the script editor itself.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Ctrl+F, search something with several matches
- Press F3

data.title: project.godot changes each time the editor is run
data.body:
under 3.0 the project.godot file is constantly changing due to editor_pid changing each launch. This is a pain for those using git or any version control. 

not sure why there are 2 listings of each? from top of my project file:
config_version=3
editor_pid=2173
config_version=null
editor_pid=2173
